summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated August 8, 2019, two days after his death. It appoints Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as executors, with Kathryn H. Ruemmler as successor executor, and bequeaths his entire estate to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust'. This is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on January 18, 2019. It details the disposition of his estate, establishes a trust, and contains provisions for tax payments and the disinheritance of any beneficiary who contests the will. The document includes witness signatures and a notary affidavit.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The individual creating the will, declaring himself a resident of St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, and directing the distribution of his estate.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will, responsible for administering the estate.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will, responsible for administering the estate alongside Darren K. Indyke.

persons.name: Kathryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Named as the successor executor if either Darren K. Indyke or Richard D. Kahn is unable or unwilling to serve.

persons.name: Amanda De`Ine
persons.context: The notary public who witnessed the signing and swearing of the will on January 18, 2019.

connections.description: Epstein appointed Indyke as an executor of his will, granting him fiduciary authority over the estate.
Epstein appointed Kahn as an executor of his will, granting him fiduciary authority over the estate.
Epstein named Ruemmler as the successor executor in his will, indicating a trusted legal relationship.
Both were appointed as co-executors of Epstein's will, requiring them to work together in administering the estate.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his last will and testament, appointing executors and directing his estate to a trust.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement for 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust' was established, which is the beneficiary of Epstein's entire estate under the will.

events.title: Execution of Jeffrey Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed and executed his Last Will and Testament in the presence of witnesses and a notary public.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will was signed on August 8, 2019, two days after his reported death in jail.
The will appoints Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as primary executors, with Kathryn H. Ruemmler as successor executor.
Epstein's entire estate is bequeathed to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust', a trust created on January 18, 2019.
Each executor is to be paid $250,000 upon completion of probate, with no other compensation for serving.

The will includes extensive powers for the executors, including broad investment, business, and litigation authority, and contains a 'no-contest' clause to disinherit any beneficiary who challenges the will or trust.
Jeffrey Epstein executed his Last Will and Testament on January 18, 2019, approximately seven months before his death.
The will establishes a trust (referenced as the 'Trust Agreement') for the disposition of the majority of his estate.
It contains a 'no-contest' clause, stating that any beneficiary who challenges the will shall be disinherited.
The document details complex provisions for the apportionment and payment of federal and state estate taxes.
The will was signed in New York County, with the notary's commission from Florida, indicating multi-state legal planning.
